description: General-Head Boundary Package - Simulates flow into or out of a cell from an external source proportional to the head difference

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

datasets.description: Maximum number of GHB cells and output unit

variables.name: Option
variables.description: Optional keyword 'AUXILIARY' followed by auxiliary variable names, and/or 'NOPRINT'.
variables.tooltip: AUXILIARY adds extra data columns. NOPRINT suppresses GHB list output to listing file.

variables.name: MXACTB
variables.description: Maximum number of GHB cells active during any stress period.
variables.tooltip: Maximum number of GHB entries used simultaneously across all stress periods.

variables.name: IGHBCB
variables.description: Unit number for cell-by-cell flow terms. 0=no output, >0=write to this unit.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, GHB flow terms saved to binary file. If 0, no cell-by-cell output.

variables.name: ITMP
variables.description: Number of GHB entries for this stress period. <0 reuses previous period data.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, ITMP entries follow. If 0, no GHB boundaries active. If < 0, reuse previous stress period data.

variables.name: NP
variables.description: Number of parameters active in this stress period.
variables.tooltip: Number of named parameters active during this stress period. Typically 0 if not using parameters.

variables.name: Layer
variables.description: Layer number of the GHB cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Layer containing the GHB boundary. 1-based index.

variables.name: Row
variables.description: Row number of the GHB cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Row location of the GHB boundary. 1-based index.

variables.name: Column
variables.description: Column number of the GHB cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Column location of the GHB boundary. 1-based index.

variables.name: Bhead
variables.description: Boundary head (L). The head in the external source.
variables.tooltip: Head of the external source. Flow = Conductance * (Bhead - head_in_cell). If Bhead > cell head, water flows into the cell.

variables.name: Conductance
variables.description: Hydraulic conductance of the interface between the external source and the cell (L^2/T).
variables.tooltip: Controls the rate of flow between the external source and the model cell. Higher values allow more flow. Units: L^2/T.
